content.title: NAMO E-Tablet Scheme
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.details: Under the Gujarat Namo Tablet Yojana, tablets are provided to students studying in colleges and universities in the state. The tablets are given to students for free and are preloaded with educational content, including textbooks, e-books, and video lectures, to facilitate their studies. The Gujarat Namo Tablet Yojana is part of the state government's efforts to promote digital learning and reduce the digital divide among students from different socioeconomic backgrounds. The tablets distributed under the scheme are equipped with 4G connectivity and have a screen size of 7 inches.
benefits: Tablets are provided to students studying in colleges and universities in the Gujarat state.
eligibility: The students should have passed the 12th examination from a recognized institution and board in Gujarat.
He or she must be in the first year of college.
Students who have taken up polytechnic are also eligible.
content.application_process: Applicants have to visit their respective colleges to enrol in the Namo tablet scheme. Then institute will provide the details of the eligible candidate's details like name, category, course, etc. in it. Institute will enter the board and the seat number which belongs to you. Institute will deposit the money (Rs. 1000) to the head of the institute. The head will generate a receipt against this payment. The receipt number and date will be entered on the website. Finally, the tablet will be provided to Applicants.
documents_required: Certificate to confirm admission in the under-graduation course or Polytechnic course.

faqs.question: What Is Namo Tablet Yojana And Who Will Get Its Benefits?
faqs.answer: Namo E Tablet Scheme Gujarat began with Gujarat students by the government went a scheme whereby those languishing below the poverty line students Rs by the state government in 1000 in branded tablet education will be provided.

faqs.question: Will The Tablet Be Available For Free In Namo E-Tablet Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, Namo E-Tablet Scheme, students will have to deposit rs. 1000 in an educational institution or college to get a tablet.

faqs.question: Who Can Apply To Get A Tablet For Rs. 1000?
faqs.answer: Gujarat State students who are living below the poverty line and whose annual family income is less than Rs. 100000, can apply for a tablet for ₹ 1000 under the Namo e tablet scheme.

faqs.question: Have To Apply Offline Or Online To Buy Namo E-Tablet?
faqs.answer: In order to buy Namo E-Tablet, you have to enroll in any institution or college to get an education up to the 12th standard, whereas the application has to be done offline.

faqs.question: What Are The Documents Required To Take Namo E Tablet?
faqs.answer: Aadhar Card, Income Certificate, Caste Certificate, Residence Certificate, BPL Card, etc.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for the Namo E Tablet?
faqs.answer: The students should have passed the 12th examination from a recognized institution and board in Gujarat. He or she must be in the first year of college. Students who have taken up polytechnic are also eligible.
